titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Matt Phillips Sketchbooks, 1962-2008 M1046
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Ryan Max Steinberg; machine-readable finding aid created by Steven Mandeville-Gamble.

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-28T10:10-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

physdesc.extent: 6.0 Linear feet
141 volumes

did.abstract: Collection contains 141 sketchbooks produced by artist Matt Phillips between 1962 and 2009.

scopecontent.head: Arrangement Note
scopecontent.p: The sketchbooks are arranged chronologically, except for recent acquisitions which are filed at the end.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Best known for his monotype work, Phillips was born in New York City in 1927. He studied at the University of Chicago (MA 1952) and attended Stanford 1952-1954. He later traveled in Europe and taught at Pennsylvania State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item identification]. Matt Phillips Sketchbooks. M1046. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased, 1999 (118 v.); gift of Matt Phillips, 1999 (2 v.); purchased, 2000 (2 v.), gift, 2000 (1 v.); purchased, 2001 (2 v.); purchased, 2002 (2 v.); purchased, 2003 (6 v.); purchaed, 2006 (1 v.); purchased, 2007 (4 v.); purchased, 2009 (1 v.)

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.
